Instruction: Set the oven's temperature to 350 degrees F and allow it to heat.
In a medium-sized bowl, blend together 1/2 cup of butter or margarine and 1 cup of sugar.
Incorporate 1 egg and whip until the mixture has a smooth texture.
In a different bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix the flour blend into the sugar blend until all elements are fully merged.
Press this mixture into the base and sides of a pair of 9-inch pie pans.
In a sizable saucepan, mix together milk, vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon of butter or margarine.
Heat over medium heat until it comes to a boil, then remove the pan from the burner.
In a different bowl, combine 2 1/2 tablespoons of flour, cornstarch, and 1/2 cup of sugar.
Mix in the beaten eggs to form a smooth mixture. Gradually whisk this mixture into the milk.
Put the pan back on heat and bring to a boil while stirring all the time.
Keep stirring and boiling for 5 minutes. Split the prepared mixture equally into each pie crust, sprinkle cinnamon over it and let it cool in the refrigerator before serving.
